Others: Kawhi Leonard made his season debut in a 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.
Leonard scored 12 points in 19 minutes, going 4-of-11 from the floor and 3-of-5 from three-point range.
The game was Leonard's first since Game 3 of the first-round playoff series versus the Dallas Mavericks in April 2024.
Leonard received a warm reception in his first game at the Clippers' $2-billion Intuit Dome.
Coach Ty Lue adhered to a minutes restriction, allowing Leonard to play just 3:36 in the second half.
Leonard's knee injury was the latest in a string of setbacks since he joined the Clippers in 2019.
Leonard has appeared in 257 regular-season and playoff games and missed 210 contests due to various injuries.
